messages.subject: What is unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/27/02 1:40:03 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/27/02 1:40:03 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< A month ago, for example, when I was new here, I listened to perhaps twenty
days of back and forth from several women about one's relationship (years
before) with a rock musician named Winger. During those (slow) times, I
often wondered how that conversation related to the list even as it took so
much space. I concluded that since no one could really address unschooling
itself, that anything goes, even old boyfriends and if they were good
kissers. No one even complained that those posts interrupted any of the
other threads, and no one seemed to care that the subject was far OT. >>


HELLOO!! Anybody home Ned?
I think Joyce and Helen (among others) have over and over and over and OVER
again explained that any topic is not OFF topic....as long as it doesn't take
over the whole list.
If you want a bunch of people to agree with you, to jump on the political
bandwagon there are OTHER lists.
No one was trying to take over the whole list with winger propaganda.
No one was trying to get a bunch of followers.
Will you please either GO away or get with the flow of the list???
Did you notice that it had a very nice flow prior to your coming on board?
That there was a lot of useful discussion?
God help us, you just won't give up.
Joyce, I am now begging you to ban this lunatic.

Ren
